'''FireDrums''' is an annual fire arts gathering held in Northern California. It is one of the longest-running dedicated fire performance events in the United States.

== History ==

FireDrums was co-founded by [[Noel Yee]] and has been held since the early 2000s. The event brings together fire spinners, fire breathers, and fire performers from across North America for workshops, performances, and community gathering.

== Format ==

The event typically includes:

* '''Workshops''': Instruction in fire [[poi]], [[Staff (flow arts)|staff]], [[Fire fans|fans]], [[Rope dart|rope dart]], and other fire props
* '''Fire circles''': Open spinning areas where performers share the space
* '''Performances''': Scheduled shows and showcases
* '''Community discussions''': Panels on safety, teaching, and the future of fire arts

== Significance ==

FireDrums has served as an important gathering point for the [[flow arts]] community, particularly for sharing technical knowledge and safety practices related to [[fire spinning]].
